thread.section_title: FAU Owls Sports News - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Florida Atlantic: Owls have committed five turnovers in each of last three games
thread.title_full: Florida Atlantic: Owls have committed five turnovers in each of last three games - Sun Sentinel

author: Shandel Richardson
title: Florida Atlantic: Owls have committed five turnovers in each of last three games
text:
The positive is the Florida Atlantic Owls can say they at least have a victory.
The negative is the same problem remains.
For a third consecutive week, the Owls committed five turnovers in a game.
"I don't know that I have the whole answer," FAU offensive coordinator Brian Wright said on Tuesday. "I think we have to focus better in meetings, focus better on the field. We can't just try to survive practice. We have to try to get better at practice and get better during the weeks."
Despite forcing seven turnovers in last Saturday's 17-7 win at Charlotte, the Owls' mistakes could have been very costly.
Quarterback Jaquez Johnson's fourth-quarter interception was returned 28 yards for a touchdown, pulling the 49ers to within 10-7. FAU was only able to seal the victory with Ocie Rose's 60-yard interception return for a score late in the fourth quarter.
"You've got to have focus throughout the week," Wright said. "You can't just show up on Saturday."
Wright said the bye week comes at the perfect time, because the team has so many offensive issues to work on. The Owls will practice Wednesday and Thursday before taking the weekend off.
"Let's just work on the things that need improved fundamentally," Wright said.
Next game: FAU vs. Rice, 2:30 p.m., Oct. 10, Fox College Sports.
Srichardson@tribpub.com
 UNC Charlotte 49ers
